column1: /media/nima/SSD/stackexchange/extracted/codereview.stackexchange.com,  <row Id=""263299"" PostTypeId=""1"" CreationDate=""2021-06-22T00:34:28.010"" Score=""2"" ViewCount=""418"" Body=""&lt
column3: I use the following code in order to assess the quality of an audio, which is based on this &lt
column15: in a loop with a different audio file in each iteration.&lt
column30: from tensorflow.keras.layers import Dense, Dropout, Conv2D&#xA
column31: from tensorflow.keras.layers import LSTM, TimeDistributed, Bidirectional&#xA
column86: # weights are in the directory of this file&#xA
column93: # load pre-trained weights. CNN_BLSTM is reported as best&#xA
column104: Evaluate the audio quality using a MOSnet (neural network).&#xA
column160: Predict the Mean Objective Score of a given frame.&#xA
column178: Since each iteration, the code computes the score using a different audio, it means the input size changes. This causes the following warning:&lt
column185: WARNING:tensorflow:6 out of the last 12 calls to &amp
column194: Tracing is expensive and the excessive number of tracings is likely due to passing python objects instead of tensors. Also, tf.function has experimental_relax_shapes=True option that relaxes argument shapes that can avoid unnecessary retracing.&#xA
column195: Please refer to https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/customization/performance#python_or_tensor_args and https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/function for more details.&#xA
column205: Unfortunately, this retracing is slowing down the code so is there any alternatives here that will disable retracing or accelerate the code?&lt
column208: Obviously, I can use GPU accelerations, but those are not an option in my case.&#xA
column209: I already tried to frame the audio signal and feed it to the prediction fucntion, which reduces the warnings but doesn't remove them all. However that is not practical since it add extra calls and slows the code down. I also tried &lt
column244: OwnerUserId=""189876"" LastActivityDate=""2021-06-22T00:34:28.010"" Title=""How to avoid retracing in tensorflow when predicting scores for inputs with different sizes"" Tags=""&lt

column194: Tracing is expensive and the excessive number of tracings is likely due to passing python objects instead of tensors. Also, tf.function has experimental_relax_shapes=True option that relaxes argument shapes that can avoid unnecessary retracing.&#xA
column195: Please refer to https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/customization/performance#python_or_tensor_args and https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/function for more details.&#xA
column205: Unfortunately, this retracing is slowing down the code so is there any alternatives here that will disable retracing or accelerate the code?&lt
column208: Obviously, I can use GPU accelerations, but those are not an option in my case.&#xA

Try using the full path with constructor syntax.&lt

column3: 初めまして。ネット上で調べましたが、解決策が無くて困っています&lt
column8: pytorchを使いたいと思い、torchとtorchvisionをインストールしたのですが、torchvisionをインポートすると&lt
column39: C:\Users\username\PycharmProjects\pukatorch5\venv\lib\site-packages\torchvision\io\image.py:11: UserWarning: Failed to load image Python extension: Could not find module 'C:\Users\username\PycharmProjects\pukatorch5\venv\Lib\site-packages\torchvision\image.pyd' (or one of its dependencies). Try using the full path with constructor syntax.&lt
column44: Failed to load image Python extension: {e}&amp
column54: Could not find moduleと言われたパスを見に行ったのですが、image.pydは存在しており、どうしたらよいのかわかりません。ご教授いただけると幸いです&lt
column96: OwnerUserId=""50550"" LastActivityDate=""2021-12-17T21:37:58.437"" Title=""torchvisionのimage.pydが見つからない"" Tags=""&lt

column3: 初めまして。ネット上で調べましたが、解決策が無くて困っています&lt
column8: pytorchを使いたいと思い、torchとtorchvisionをインストールしたのですが、torchvisionをインポートすると&lt
column39: C:\Users\username\PycharmProjects\pukatorch5\venv\lib\site-packages\torchvision\io\image.py:11: UserWarning: Failed to load image Python extension: Could not find module 'C:\Users\username\PycharmProjects\pukatorch5\venv\Lib\site-packages\torchvision\image.pyd' (or one of its dependencies). Try using the full path with constructor syntax.&lt
column44: Failed to load image Python extension: {e}&amp
column54: Could not find moduleと言われたパスを見に行ったのですが、image.pydは存在しており、どうしたらよいのかわかりません。ご教授いただけると幸いです&lt
column96: OwnerUserId=""50550"" LastActivityDate=""2021-12-17T21:37:58.437"" Title=""torchvisionのimage.pydが見つからない"" Tags=""&lt

column3: Знакомлюсь с библиотекой PyTorch. Разрабатываю GAN, который будет генерировать изображения с использованием контекста. Отсюда требование накладывать маску на изображения из обучающей выборки и невозможность использовать стандартный класс загрузки и предобработки (ImageFolder). Вот часть используемого класса:&lt
column11: def __init__(self, root, transforms_=None, image_size=image_size, mask_size=mask_size, mode=&amp
column91: C:\Users\Павел\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python38\lib\site-packages\torchvision\transforms\transforms.py:257: UserWarning: Argument interpolation should be of type InterpolationMode instead of int. Please, use InterpolationMode enum.&#xA
column121: num_samples should be a positive integer &amp
column124: ValueError: num_samples should be a positive integer value, but got num_samples=0&lt
column132: Среди ответов людей на тот же вопрос от других пользователей были предположения о том, что:&lt
column145: Отсутствует или неверно определен метод len.&lt
column153: Но я честно не понимаю, в чем проблема. len выводит 1044 (столько данных и имеется), а значит и путь указан верный. Как итог, не смог самостоятельно разобраться в проблеме и прошу Вашей помощи.&lt
column156: OwnerUserId=""364669"" LastActivityDate=""2023-10-14T11:00:30.070"" Title=""PyTorch. ValueError: num_samples should be a positive integer value, but got num_samples=0"" Tags=""&lt
